title: Woman charged in connection with Trigg Co. quadruple homicide
content:
CADIZ, KY (WSMV) -
A woman has been indicted by a Trigg County grand jury in connection with a quadruple homicide.
Ann Plotkin, 41, was arrested and booked into the Christian County Jail on Wednesday.
Investigators believe Plotkin may have had knowledge of the murders. She faces three charges of murder by complicity and resisting arrest.
Plotkin is expected to be arraigned in Trigg Circuit Court on Friday, the same day as Ryan Champion's next court appearance.
Police believe Champion worked with 22-year-old Vito Riservato to kill Champion's parents and sister at their home in Cadiz, KY. Champion then allegedly turned the gun on Riservato.
Shortly after the murder, Champion said Riservato shot and killed his family and he was able to turn the tables.
Plotkin is expected to be arraigned in Trigg Circuit Court on Friday.
Stay with Channel 4 and WSMV.com for more on this developing story.
